fixes.name: Discount Amount
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated row-level multiplication from Tableau: [Discount Amount] = [Sales]*[Discount]. Uses table-qualified column references. This is a row-level calculation so created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Discount Health
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated row-level division from Tableau: [Discount Health] = [Discount Amount]/[Sales]. Uses DIVIDE to guard against division by zero and table-qualified references. Created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Discount Tier
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Health] > 0.25, "High Discount",
    IF(
        'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Health] > 0.10, "Medium Discount",
        "Low Discont"
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated nested IF/ELSEIF logic from Tableau for discount tiers using table-qualified references. Row-level classification -> calculated column.

fixes.name: Loss Flag
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated row-level IF that sets a binary flag when Profit < 0. Uses table-qualified reference. Created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Failure Risk
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Loss Flag] = 1 && 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Tier] = "High Discount ",
    "High Risk",
    "Low Risk"
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated Tableau IF with logical AND. Preserves the exact string literal "High Discount " (including trailing space) and uses table-qualified references. Row-level logic -> calculated column.

fixes.name: Revenue Stability
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated row-level addition from Tableau: [Revenue Stability] = [Net Revenue ] + [Profit Ratio ]. Uses table-qualified references. Created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Stability Tier
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Revenue Stability] > 200, "Stable",
    IF(
        'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Revenue Stability] > 50, "Moderate",
        "Unstable"
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated Tableau IF/ELSEIF cascade for stability tiers using table-qualified references. Row-level classification -> calculated column.

fixes.name: Final Score
fixes.dax_expression: IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Tier] = "Low Discont", 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Performance Code] + 1, 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Performance Code])
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated row-level IF from Tableau: increments Performance Code when Discount Tier is "Low Discont". Uses table-qualified references. Created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Order Health Score
fixes.dax_expression: IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Failure Risk] = "High Risk", 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Final Score] - 2, 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Final Score])
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated row-level IF that adjusts Final Score based on Failure Risk. Uses table-qualified references. Created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Overall Rating
fixes.dax_expression: IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Priority Segment] = "Top Priority", 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Order Health Score] + 1, 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Order Health Score])
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated row-level conditional increment from Tableau. Uses table-qualified references. Created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Priority Segment
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit Health] = "Excellent" && 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profitablity Tier] = "High Margin",
    "Top Priority",
    "Normal"
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated Tableau IF with AND to DAX using table-qualified references. Row-level logic -> calculated column.

fixes.name: Performance Code
fixes.dax_expression: IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Is High Performing ] = "Yes", 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Quality Score ] + 2, 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Quality Score ] - 1)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated row-level IF that adjusts Quality Score depending on Is High Performing. Uses table-qualified references and preserves original column names. Created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Profit Margin %
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated simple arithmetic from Tableau: multiply Profit Ratio by 100. Uses table-qualified references. Row-level -> calculated column.

fixes.name: Revenue Tier
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Net Revenue ] > 1000, "High Margin",
    IF(
        'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit Margin %] > 10, "Medium Margin",
        "Low Margin"
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated Tableau IF/ELSEIF for revenue tiers using table-qualified references. Row-level classification -> calculated column.

fixes.name: Profit Health
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit Ratio ] > 0.2,
    IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Revenue Tier] = "High", "Excellent", "Good"),
    IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Revenue Tier] = "Low", "Poor", "Average")
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated nested conditional logic from Tableau for profit health. Preserves original string comparisons exactly and uses table-qualified references. Row-level -> calculated column.

fixes.name: Overall Health
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Overall Rating] > 5 && 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Stability Tier] = "Stable",
    "Excellent",
    IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Overall Rating] > 3, "Good", "Poor")
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated Tableau IF/ELSEIF with AND to DAX. Uses table-qualified references and returns textual health categories. Row-level logic -> calculated column.

fixes.name: Alert Flag
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Rank Category ] = "Tier 3" && 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Failure Risk] = "High Risk",
    "Alert",
    "Normal"
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated Tableau IF with AND to DAX for alert detection. Uses table-qualified references and preserves exact literal values. Row-level logic -> calculated column.

fixes.name: Final Performnace Label
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated Tableau IF/ELSE to DAX: when Alert Flag equals "Alert" return "Critical" else return Overall Health. Uses table-qualified references. This is row-level logic so created as a calculated column.
